intro: Discocarpus nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan discocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
